payloads.defensive_notes:
Education-only (non-executing).
- Avoid dynamic command construction.
- Enforce strict input validation.
- Avoid shell=True patterns in process spawning.
- Prefer exec-style APIs with argument arrays (argv).
- Apply strict allow-lists for user-controlled parameters.
- Apply least privilege to service accounts.
- Prefer SDK/library APIs over invoking shell utilities.
payloads.description: Concept: dynamic command building may enable chained execution paths.
payloads.title: Command Chaining Concept (linux) - Template

payloads.defensive_notes:
Education-only (non-executing).
- Root cause: concatenating user input into shell commands.
- Primary defense: avoid shell invocation entirely.
- Avoid shell=True patterns in process spawning.
- Prefer exec-style APIs with argument arrays (argv).
- Apply strict allow-lists for user-controlled parameters.
- Apply least privilege to service accounts.
- Prefer SDK/library APIs over invoking shell utilities.
payloads.description: Concept: untrusted input influencing system command construction may alter execution flow.
payloads.title: Command Injection (Basic Concept) (linux) - Template

payloads.defensive_notes:
Education-only (non-executing).
- Do not rely on character blacklists.
- Use structured execution (argv arrays), not shell parsing.
- Avoid shell=True patterns in process spawning.
- Prefer exec-style APIs with argument arrays (argv).
- Apply strict allow-lists for user-controlled parameters.
- Apply least privilege to service accounts.
- Prefer SDK/library APIs over invoking shell utilities.
payloads.description: Concept: shell parsing rules may interpret separators as command boundaries.
payloads.title: Command Separator Concept (linux) - Template

payloads.defensive_notes:
Education-only (non-executing).
- Architectural prevention > keyword filtering.
- Add sandboxing and least privilege.
- Avoid shell=True patterns in process spawning.
- Prefer exec-style APIs with argument arrays (argv).
- Apply strict allow-lists for user-controlled parameters.
- Apply least privilege to service accounts.
- Prefer SDK/library APIs over invoking shell utilities.
payloads.description: Concept: naive filtering may fail across encodings and shell behaviors.
payloads.title: Filter Evasion Concepts (linux) - Template

payloads.defensive_notes:
Education-only (non-executing).
- Avoid exposing platform details.
- Do not return raw command output.
- Avoid shell=True patterns in process spawning.
- Prefer exec-style APIs with argument arrays (argv).
- Apply strict allow-lists for user-controlled parameters.
- Apply least privilege to service accounts.
- Prefer SDK/library APIs over invoking shell utilities.
payloads.description: Concept: behavioral differences may reveal underlying OS type.
payloads.title: OS Detection Logic Concept (linux) - Template
